intro: Jacea dracunculifolia, commonly known as the Indian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, while its stems are erect and branched. Jacea dracunculifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
